definitions: To add salt to food or other substances.
To make something more interesting or lively.
To treat a road or path with salt to melt ice or snow.
To give a deceptive appearance of value to something, especially a mine, by scattering valuable mineral ore on it.
examples: She likes to salt her food generously.
They used to salt fish to preserve it for winter.
He tried to salt his story with humor.
The city salts the roads before a snowstorm.
The con artist salted the mine to trick investors.
